projectDesc.p: David Livingstone writes this portion of his diary entries over the recto and verso (RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_001r_172ar and RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_001v_172av) of a single page of unmarked stationary. This stationary was originally sent to Livingstone in a separate envelope (RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_002r_172br and RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_002v_172bv) that Livingstone has also used to record diary entries. RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_002v_172bv bears the handwritten address "Dr. Kirk Consulate Zanzibar care of H.M. Commissioner Seychelles". Livingstone's text is what is transcribed and represented in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) P5 XML encoding. In addition, the present folio includes the phrase "Oct. 1871" at the top of the page just above Livingstone's date and the number "172a" in the upper right-hand corner in a second, unknown hand.

revisionDesc.change: 2011-06-12 Adrian S. Wisnicki initial transcription and XML encoding.

div.p:
23d arrived at Ujiji = and
found that Shereef had sold off
all my goods for slaves & ivory
in spite of remonstrance by
the chief men here - came impudently
and offered me his hand !!!

25th call Shereef & demand my
goods - said Ludha had ordered him
to stay a month & then leave
Had divined on Koran & found
I was dead - then sold all = write letter

26th News from Garaganza
many Arabs killed - road
shut up - one Englishman there
